body_html:
I was using the following instructions https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_windows [image: Inline image 1] After creating a fresh environment, activating it and running the (tensorflow)C:> *pip install --ignore-installed --upgrade tensorflow-gpu* command, conda no longer responded to any of the current command line flags. I kept getting a choice error then a bunch of options. When I ran conda version (not conda --version because that raised an error) it said "wheel-0.30" or something to that effect. I've tracked this error back to a few threads and all seem to be after attempting to install tensorflow-gpu. ContinuumIO/anaconda-issues#6171 https://groups.google.com/a/continuum.io/forum/#!msg/anaconda/5F_tTvy1Vvk/LpS2yyEoAQAJ antoniosehk/keras-tensorflow-windows-installation#1 https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46356732/anaconda-prompt-corrupts-after-installation https://stackoverflow.com/questions/47244290/anaconda-commands-stopped-working
…
On Wed, Nov 29, 2017 at 3:12 PM, Andrew Selle ***@***.***> wrote: Well that is not consistent with the stackoverflow question you linked. Could you please be precise about what instructions you followed by posting a link here, and tell me where you would like a warning included. I'm happy to help, but you need to provide more information. — You are receiving this because you authored the thread. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#14980 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAs3JBTUMVBG8_AXpaUcj807OM9TVyrWks5s7eTEgaJpZM4QvjtP> .
-- Ken Pierce kpierce8@gmail.com
body_text:
I was using the following instructions

https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_windows

[image: Inline image 1]
After creating a fresh environment, activating it and running the

(tensorflow)C:> *pip install --ignore-installed --upgrade tensorflow-gpu*

command, conda no longer responded to any of the current command line
flags. I kept getting a choice error then a bunch of options. When I ran
conda version (not conda --version because that raised an error) it said
"wheel-0.30" or something to that effect. I've tracked this error back to a
few threads and all seem to be after attempting to install tensorflow-gpu.

ContinuumIO/anaconda-issues#6171

https://groups.google.com/a/continuum.io/forum/#!msg/anaconda/5F_tTvy1Vvk/LpS2yyEoAQAJ

antoniosehk/keras-tensorflow-windows-installation#1

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46356732/anaconda-prompt-corrupts-after-installation

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/47244290/anaconda-commands-stopped-working

…
On Wed, Nov 29, 2017 at 3:12 PM, Andrew Selle ***@***.***> wrote:
 Well that is not consistent with the stackoverflow question you linked.
 Could you please be precise about what instructions you followed by posting
 a link here, and tell me where you would like a warning included. I'm happy
 to help, but you need to provide more information.

 —
 You are receiving this because you authored the thread.

body:
I was using the following instructions

https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_windows

[image: Inline image 1]
After creating a fresh environment, activating it and running the

(tensorflow)C:> *pip install --ignore-installed --upgrade tensorflow-gpu*

command, conda no longer responded to any of the current command line
flags. I kept getting a choice error then a bunch of options. When I ran
conda version (not conda --version because that raised an error) it said
"wheel-0.30" or something to that effect. I've tracked this error back to a
few threads and all seem to be after attempting to install tensorflow-gpu.

https://github.com/ContinuumIO/anaconda-issues/issues/6171

https://groups.google.com/a/continuum.io/forum/#!msg/anaconda/5F_tTvy1Vvk/LpS2yyEoAQAJ

https://github.com/antoniosehk/keras-tensorflow-windows-installation/issues/1

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46356732/anaconda-prompt-corrupts-after-installation

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/47244290/anaconda-commands-stopped-working



On Wed, Nov 29, 2017 at 3:12 PM, Andrew Selle <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Could you please be precise about what instructions you followed by posting

> to help, but you need to provide more information.
